org.hrva.capture
Class CSVWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.hrva.capture.CSVWriter

public class CSVWriter
extends java.lang.Object

Writes a CSV-format file using a Map<String,String> structure to provide column names and values.

This uses the "quotes-optional" and "Unix newline" dialect of CSV.

Here's a typical use case.

      String[] headings = { "Column 1", "Column 2" };
      Writer target= new FileWriter( some_file );
      CSVWriter csvwtr = new CSVWriter(target, headings);
      csvwtr.writeheading();
      Map<String, String> csv;
      csv = build_map_from_source(line);
      csvwtr.writerow(csv);
      csvwtr.close();

Constructor Detail

CSVWriter

public CSVWriter(java.io.Writer wtr,
                 java.lang.String[] columns)
Opens the writer with a list of columns to use for the heading. Any additional values on a given row are silently ignored.

Parameters:
wtr - A writer which will be used to write CSV output.
columns - An array of column names.
Method Detail

escape

public void escape(java.lang.String value)
            throws java.io.IOException
Writes a single escaped value to the CSV file. This adds quotes for special cases and doubles internal quotes.

Parameters:
value - A String to quote if necessary.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeheading

public void writeheading()
                  throws java.io.IOException
Writes the heading row to the file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writerow

public void writerow(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> row)
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes a row to the file.

Additional columns are silently ignored. Missing columns are left blank.

Parameters:
row - A Map to map Headings To Values.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
